lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* This function simulates a chat bot who interacts with a user to keep track of a todo list.
this.ui = new Ui(); // Performs the self introduction upon successful initialization.
* This function is the body of the chat bot, and contains the flow and commands.
public void run() throws DukeExceptions, IOException {
String user_command; // this is the container for the full command received from the user
String cmd; // this is the container for the first word of the command received from the user
///// This listens for the commands and interprets them
// This part listens for user input and repeats until the command "bye" is identified
// 'list' : Retrieves information from the hard drive and prints it
// 'done [int]' : marks the corresponding number in the list as done
// Else, an item has been added to the chat bot
// Commands are either todo, deadline or event
public static void main(String[] args) throws DukeExceptions, IOException {
* This class performs the commands in Duke.
* Adds a deadline to the task list.
* @param user_command The command inputted from the user
* @param cmd The type of task added to the task list
* @param taskList The task list which contains the tasks
public void addDeadline(String user_command, String cmd, TaskList taskList)
* Adds an event to the task list.
* @param user_command The command inputted from the user
* @param cmd The type of task added to the task list
* @param taskList The task list which contains the tasks
public void addEvent(String user_command, String cmd, TaskList taskList)
* Adds a todo to the task list.
* @param user_command The command inputted from the user
* @param cmd The type of task added to the task list
* @param taskList The task list which contains the tasks
public void addTodo(String user_command, String cmd, TaskList taskList)
* Deletes a specified item from the task list.
* @param user_command The command inputted from the user
* @param taskList The task list which contains the tasks
public void delete(String user_command, TaskList taskList) throws NotDoneRightException, IOException {
* Marks a specified item from the task list as done.
* @param user_command The command inputted from the user
* @param taskList The task list which contains the tasks
public void done(String user_command, TaskList taskList) throws IOException, NotDoneRightException {
// Throws exception if there is error accessing the integer following "done"
// Marks the task as done and prints statements as proof
* Finds all items from the task list that match a given string.
* @param user_command The command inputted from the user
* @param taskList The task list which contains the tasks
public void find(String user_command, TaskList taskList) throws EmptyDescriptionException {
* Lists all the items in the task list.
* @param taskList The task list which contains the tasks.
* This function encapsulates exceptions thrown by the chat bot when the user gives a command that does not exist.
super("Sorry! The command \"" + message + "\" doesn't exist :(\nPlease try again!");
* This function encapsulates exceptions thrown by the chat bot where there is an error deleting an item.
super("Please input an integer in the range of " + start + " to " + end + "!");
* This function encapsulates exceptions thrown by the chat bot.
* This function encapsulates exceptions thrown by the chat bot where the description for a task is empty.
super("Sorry! There needs to be a description for a " + message + " item :(\nPlease try again!");
* This function encapsulates exceptions thrown by the chat bot where details are missing from a task.
super("Sorry! Please include more details for a " + message + " item :(\nPlease try again!");
* This function encapsulates exceptions thrown by the chat bot when commands for "done" is not entered correctly.
super("Please input an integer in the range of " + start + " to " + end + "!");
* This class handles interaction with the user.
* Interprets user command and creates logs
* Returns the command (the first word) given.
* @return Command (which is the first word) from the user
* Checks if the second integer is viable for the done and delete commands and returns it.
* @param size The length of the taskList
* @return The second word (aka the number) from the user
public int getSecondInteger(int size) throws NotDoneRightException {
* Returns the information of a Todo task.
* @return The description of a Todo task
* Returns information about a Deadline task.
* @return The description of a Deadline task
* Returns the date of a Deadline task.
* @return The date of a Deadline task
* Returns the information of an Event task.
* @return The description of an Event task
* Returns the location/additional information of an Event task.
* @return The location/context of an Event task
* This class handles the storage of the current list (i.e. the updating and retrieval).
private final ArrayList<String> commandsSaved = new ArrayList<>(); // array of saved lines in the new txt file
* Loads the existing file for the todo list if it exists, or creates a file if it does not.
* @return an ArrayList of tasks for the todo list
// If the file exists, print out the previous data if it exists
System.out.println("Oops! Looks like you don't have anything saved :(");
// Interprets each line of the file / each command
boolean taskState = Integer.parseInt(txtFileCmd[1]) != 0;  // 0 for not done, 1 for done
// Checks the task type (i.e. deadline, todo or event) and add them to tasks respectively
// If the file does not exist, create a new file
System.out.println("Let me create a save file for you :)");
* Updates the textArr element after it has been marked as "done".
* @param ref The index of the item in the textArr being referenced to
* @param s The string to be added to the textArr
public void updateDone(int ref, String s) throws IOException {
* Adds a task to the commandsSaved.
* @param s The string to be added to the commandsSaved.
public void addTask(String s) throws IOException {
* Removes the task referenced to from commandsSaved.
* @param ref The index of the item in the commandsSaved being referenced to be removed.
public void removeTask(int ref) throws IOException{
* This function handles the list of tasks maintained by the system.
// The constructor takes in an array of tasks and saves it as the taskList.

* Returns the number of elements in the taskList.
* @return The number of elements in the taskList
* Returns a specific element from the taskList.
* @param index The index of the task in the taskList
* @return The desired element at the index specified

* Removes a specified element from the taskList.

* @param word The word that is searched for in the tasks.
* @return An ArrayList of String representing tasks that match the searched word.
* This class encapsulates the Deadline Task.
public Deadline(String description, LocalDate dateBy, boolean isDone) {
* Returns the string of the task to be represented in the list.
* @returns the string of the task to be represented in the list
* Returns the string of the task to be represented in the text file.
* @returns the string of the task to be represented in the text file
* This class encapsulates the Event Task.
public Event(String description, String eventDetails, boolean isDone) {
* This function returns the string of the task to be represented in the list.
* @returns the string of the task to be represented in the list
* This function returns the string of the task to be represented in the text file.
* @returns the string of the task to be represented in the text file
public String getStatusString() { return "D@" + (isDone ? 1 : 0) + "@" + this.description + "@" + this.eventDetails; }
* Returns an 'X' if the task has been marked as done, and an " " otherwise.
* @returns the string of the task to be represented in the list
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Sets the isDone attribute to true, which marks a task as done.
* Returns the string representation of the task completion.
* @returns the string representation of the task completion
* Returns the representation of the task to be saved in the text file.
* This class encapsulates the Todo Task.
* Returns the string of the task to be represented in the list.
* @returns the string of the task to be represented in the list
* Returns the string of the task to be represented in the text file.
* @returns the string of the task to be represented in the text file
* This class handles the outputs for logging purposes and responding to the user.
///// Introduction of the robot every time Duke is initialised
System.out.println("\nHaro, I'm Taro! Taro is short for Notaro because I'm Not-a-ro-bot!!");
* Prints out a welcome message when a user starts using the chatbot, and prints the possible order
System.out.println("There are three special tasks you can add: Deadline, Event and Todo");
System.out.println("list : Adds stuff into your todo list :(");
System.out.println("done [number] : Marks the item corresponding the number in the todo list as complete!");
System.out.println("find [word] : Searches the todo list for the word inputted and shows all matches");
System.out.println("delete [number] : Deletes the item corresponding the number in the todo list");
System.out.println("\nWhat can I do for you today? :>");
* Prints out a message when a 'bye' command is entered  (when the program ends).
System.out.println("Bye bye!! It was nice meeting you!");
* Logs the addition of a Task.
* @param taskType The type of task which has been added (Deadline, Todo or Event).
* @param command The command the user inputted.
public void showAddition(String taskType, String command) {
* Logs the removal of a Task.
* @param taskRemoved The task removed by the user.
* @param taskListSize The size of the current list of tasks
public void showRemoval(String taskRemoved, int taskListSize) {
System.out.println("Oki! I have removed this task:");
* Prints out the taskList in a neat manner.
* @param tasks The current list of tasks.
System.out.println("Yay! Nothing on your list right now :>");
* Logs the completion of a Task.
* @param command The task which has been completed.
* Logs the completion of a Task.
* @param wordList The list of commands with matches to the searched word.
System.out.println("You don't have anything in your todo list with that word!");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
